profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: The collection includes correspondence, research, publication and committee files, with some photographs.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: The papers were given to Stanford University by Tjeerd H. van Andel in 1988 and 2009.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least 48 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Tjeerd H. van Andel Papers (SC0349). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Born in the Netherlands, Tjeerd H. van Andel came to the United States in 1957. He taught at Scripps Institute of Oceanography and Oregon State before coming to Stanford in 1976. He was an authority on the geology of ocean floors and mid-ocean ridges, with an interest in the prehistory of landscape and civilization which has led to work on climatic change and its economic ramifications. He was a co-leader of Project FAMOUS (French American Mid-Ocean Undersea Study), data from which led directly to the confirmation of plate tectonic theory. Van Andel died in 2010.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence, research, publication and committee files, with some photographs.
